conclusion: The task is to predict which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.

The first image shows a board with colored sticks and markers, points A, B, and C at the top (with color-coded tabs), various angled barriers/baffles across the board, and two container-shaped structures at the bottom labeled D and E.
The second and third images show liquid flow patterns when released from the top points A, B, and C.
In the second image, liquid from point A (yellow) flows downward and hits the brown baffle, getting deflected to the left.
In the third image, the yellow liquid continues flowing leftward and ultimately flows into container D (the left/yellow container).

premise: Liquid from point A flows downward, hits the brown baffle, gets deflected to the left, and ultimately flows into container D.
conclusion: Liquid from point A flows into container D.
In the second and third images, liquid from point B (teal) flows downward, hits the teal baffle, and is redirected to the right side of the board.
The teal liquid interacts with the orange flow from point C and ultimately flows into container E (the right/pink container).

premise: Liquid from point B flows downward, hits the teal baffle, is redirected to the right, interacts with the orange flow, and ultimately flows into container E.
conclusion: Liquid from point B flows into container E.
In the second and third images, liquid from point C (orange) flows downward, hits a baffle, and gets redirected.
The orange liquid joins with some of the teal liquid and ultimately flows into container E (the right/pink container).

premise: Liquid from point C flows downward, hits a baffle, gets redirected, joins with some of the teal liquid, and ultimately flows into container E.
conclusion: Liquid from point C flows into container E.

premise: Liquid from point A flows into container D. Liquid from points B and C flow into container E.
conclusion: Liquid from point A will flow into container D. Liquid from points B and C will flow into container E.
